content.description:
Start on a good edge on the flat wall in the very back of the cave. Climb straight out of the center of the roof on huge jugs. At the lip, climb into the right-trending undercling crack, and take it to the top.

It's incredibly fun and the one to do if you're not ready for the taller lines on the wall.
content.location: Lower into the cave. Start in the deepest part of the cave, and climb straight up into the jugs.

content.description: Rap or swim into the cave. Pull onto the middle of the water polished face, and climb thin crimps to the top. This is one of the scariest climbs in The Narrows.

Start in the very back of the cave on the flat wall. Climb the jugs directly out of the center of the roof. This is the same start as

The Chambered Nautilus

and

Reverie

.

Pull onto the face, and climb straight up using the vertical rail with sidepulls on it. You will be about five feet to the left of the

Reverie

crack.

Mantel the top, and climb the slab up and left.
content.location:
It starts in the back of the cave. Go straight up once you reach the lip.

Lower the same as

Nautilus

/

Involuntary Clairvoyance

in order to get into the cave.

content.description: Rap or swim into the cave. Climb the obvious rail features left and up to the apex of the wall. Involuntary Clairvoyance is a stellar adventure on water polished granite.

Start on the ledge on the left side of the cave -- the same start as The

Nautilus

and

Involuntary Clairvoyance

. Climb the large crack to the left until you can gain the arete to the left of

Involuntary Clairvoyance

. Go straight up the arete and into the face above. Top out on the highest point of the wall.

The "R" rating may not apply if you get there before late August when the water drops. This is listed as a sport climb due to the YDS grade, but it is a DWS -- there are no bolts.
content.location:
Start on the ledge in the cave -- the same start as

Nautilus

and

Involuntary Clairvoyance

. See Nautilus Wall page for detailed instructions on the approach.

content.description:
This climbs the same start as

Reverie

and links into

Nautilus

. Start on a good edge on the flat wall in the very back of the cave, and climb the jugs out of the center of the roof. From the lip, traverse left on a rail into the crux of

Nautilus

, and finish straight up.
content.location: Start in the back of the cave.

content.description:
Amnesiac is another phenomenal and exciting climb that traverses the entire wall and finishes on the

Involuntary Clairvoyance

topout.

Start on a ledge to the right of the cave. Downclimb a few feet on water polished rock until you reach a large, juggy horn. You will be right above the water at this point. Climb the arch formation over the cave, and follow a flat rail left into the middle of

Involuntary Clairvoyance

, which will take you to the top.

As always, check the water levels. It is a long fall from the upper holds.
content.location:
Start at the bottom right of the wall. Lower yourself to a ledge, and downclimb. It is possible to downclimb the slabs above

Reverie

into position, but that is not recommended due to loose and dirty rock.
